div.class: inner col col8 first last id069f1999-1683-48d4-b8f4-7d00148f7379

h4.a: Declaration of Emergency & Executive Order Timeframes now May 11th, 2020

li.div: The Town Council voted to extend the end date of the local Declaration of Emergency to May 11th, 2020 and the Town Manager has amended several Executive Orders to extend the timeframes through May 11th, 2020. Read on...

The Town Manager issued Executive Order 2020-06 today, to EXTEND the Stay at Home and Gatherings Limited to 5 orders through May 8th, 2020, indicate penalties for noncompliance, and to authorize parking restrictions in beach areas. Read on...
The Town Manager issued Executive Order 2020-07 today, authorizing a suspension of the "Plastic Bag Ban" for the duration of the local state of emergency. Read on...

h4.a: Residential Bulky Waste and Bulky Yard Waste Closure

li.div: As a result of the COVID-19 pandemic, effective Saturday, April 4, 2020, the Rose Hill Regional Transfer Station (RHRTS) will no longer be accepting residential bulky waste or bulky yard waste. Read on...

The Town of South Kingstown has made the difficult decision to close additional South Kingstown Parks and Recreation facilities in order to minimize the risk of overcrowding at municipal parks. Read on...

h4.a: Construction to Begin for Middlebridge Stormwater Improvements

li.div: Middlebridge Stormwater Improvements construction scheduled to begin Monday, April 6th... Read on...

The Town has made the difficult decision to close the South Kingstown Dog Park, the South Kingstown Skate Park, all athletic fields and basketball courts, and the Main Street Comfort Station. Playgrounds remain closed. Read on...

STAY AT HOME Order issued EFFECTIVE IMMEDIATELY, Directives to RI residents who commute to other states, Gatherings limited to NOT MORE THAN 5, Non-Critical Businesses CLOSED as of Monday March 30th, and REQUIRED 14 Day Quarantine for ALL Travelers to RI Read on...
The Town Manager has released a letter to Seasonal Residents & Visitors to South Kingstown. Read on...
Executive Order 2020-03 regarding seasonal residents and visitors was amended to provide additional information and directives. Read on...
